column4: hey, dumb-sounding question - apt-get installed irssi but it doesn't show up as a command, nor is it in /usr/bin or /usr/local/bin
k 2 secs
irssi should install to /usr/bin/ =/
yeah, that's what I thought. :( man pages are there and apt thinks it is installed
That's odd. What version of Ubuntu are you using?
sudo apt-get purge irssi && sudo apt-get install irssi
that'll reinstall it; might help
copy the output of "apt-cache policy irssi" to http://paste.ubuntu.com/, then put a link to the created page here.
it's only two lines....
oh. Just paste it here then (I'm not on Ubuntu right now; forgot how long/short it was)
hrm. that looks fine too.
it didn't seem to delete the package when I purged... maybe I can try that and/por use a different repo?
yeah, I guess
if you're interested, removing and DLing from main repo worked. My fastest repo's copy must be broken or something weird
pretty sure xulrunner isn't a dependency of sudo =/
I am using a properly-configured client. He's using a non-standard character set.
Shows up fine here, and I' don't have any japanese fonts - I'm just using plain ol irssi. Anyway, it's not life and death.
fyi, I just installed Ubuntu's default non-Latin font set and oheyu's stuff now shows up fine, so yes, it was fonts.
did you try just setting the system charset? I'm not trying to be smart, just asking
my entire stack from irc client, through screen, to my terminal is set to utf8. It's a font thing. Like I said, I installed fonts, it now works.
right, but if you do export CHARSET=ISO-8859-15 shouldn't that also fix it?
I have no idea, and this isn't something I intend to do.
